dt: {bc}to enter or become established in gradually or unobtrusively usually for subversive purposes

dt.t: the intelligence staff had been {it}infiltrated{/it} by spies

dt: {bc}to pass (troops) singly or in small groups through gaps in the enemy line
{bc}to pass into or through (a substance) by filtering or permeating
{bc}to cause (something, such as a liquid) to permeate something by penetrating its pores or interstices
{bc}to enter, permeate, or pass through a substance or area by filtering or by insinuating gradually

shortdef: to enter or become established in gradually or unobtrusively usually for subversive purposes
to pass (troops) singly or in small groups through gaps in the enemy line
to pass into or through (a substance) by filtering or permeating
